intro: Vulpiella stipoides var. multiflora, commonly known as the multiflora grass, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, often hairy stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the grass family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetland or riparian habitats. Due to its ecological importance, it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
